item.title: Single GPU Passthrough on linux with AMD
item.description: Hello folks, here are the steps I had to take to eventually get single GPU passthrough working on Arch Linux with QEMU with an AMD GPU (specifically a PowerColor Red Devil 5700XT 8GB), the problems i had to face and the solutions I found to said problems. But first, why? Well, dual-booting Windows has always been a bummer to me. Sure, it works wonders in terms of performance for gaming, you’re playing on actual Windows without any translation going on, but having to reboot the computer and dedicating a specific amount of space for it always rubbed me the wrong way.
